Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the consequences of publishing posts on COVID-19 by stating that it is a punishable offense under the Disaster Management Act.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that publishing posts on COVID-19 is a punishable offense.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Disaster Management Act includes provisions to punish individuals for publishing posts on COVID-19, which is not supported by the evidence provided.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, as the Ministry of Home Affairs invoked the Disaster Management Act for the lockdown, but it does not mention a ban on social media posts.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that sections 140 and 188 mentioned in the misleading post do not exist under the Disaster Management Act.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
